event: Earliest human presence in present-day Colombia
Early agriculture and permanent settlements develop
Advanced goldworking cultures emerge
Zenú culture develops large-scale hydraulic systems
San Agustín culture creates monumental stone sculptures
Tairona societies flourish in the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta
Muisca Confederation dominates the central highlands
Spanish explorers reach the Caribbean coast
Santa Marta is founded by the Spanish
Cartagena is founded as a major colonial port
Spanish conquest of the Muisca heartland
Bogotá is founded as a colonial capital
Royal Audiencia consolidates colonial administration
Cartagena becomes a key fortified Atlantic port
Viceroyalty of New Granada is created
Comunero Revolt challenges colonial rule
Independence movement begins in Bogotá
Battle of Boyacá secures independence victory
Gran Colombia is established
Gran Colombia dissolves into separate states
Slavery is abolished
Centralized Republic of Colombia is established
Thousand Days’ War devastates the country
Panama secedes from Colombia
Bogotazo triggers a decade of political violence
National Front power-sharing stabilizes politics
FARC guerrilla movement is founded
New constitution expands rights and decentralization
Peace accord with FARC ends major armed conflict
